name: The Saratoga Farmstead B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rosemary and Mariana took care of EVERYTHING. They were extremely flexible on our arrival time and set up the room with 30 plus candles I had dropped off. They also made a beautiful presentation with champagne, strawberries, and a rose I dropped off. The room was clean and comfortable and had a private porch. Breakfast was delicious and they even catered to my fiancee's gluten free diet. Their personal touch made our engagement night a very special stay and we plan to return for future celebrations.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Plan to Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and I are naive travellers. My first time in USA, both of us had heard of Saratoga Springs stories as children, so headed off that way, as you do.
reviews.title: What a winner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We googled B&B info and lucked onto this site.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Friendly Country Respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay! Everything could not have been more perfect.
reviews.title: The Saratoga Springs Fabulous Farmstead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: The surroundings, a mere sneeze from downtown but in a deceptively rural-like setting. The Farmstead was homely but not twee and welcoming and with more comforts than home. Our room in The Hayloft offered beautiful views and very comfortable sleeping.
reviews.title: Stay with them you'll enjoy it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Myself and four girlfriends stayed in the Hayloft and it was perfect. Our hosts were friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast was delicious, the whole home was decorated beautifully and the oatmeal/ date cookies were to die for. We will make this our annual place to stay, for sure!
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were graciously met and immediatey shown around. The attention to detail was superb! The rooms are spacious and immaculate. Every inch of the entire place is pristinely clean and kept up. Everything was perfect!. The breakfast was fresh and prepared as we were seated. The coffee was the best! The Frittata, berries, ham and homefries perfect. The environment is warm and friendly. The ladies were totally accomodating, kind natured and wonderful. We sat on he porch in the evening in such peace with our friends who met us there. It was a wonderful stay. A perfect place!
reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband & I enjoyed our stay at the Saratoga Farm Stead B & B. When we arrived on Friday Mariana met us at the door with a pleasant greeting calling us by name, then she introduced herself & proceeded to show us around. The B & B was so quaint & peaceful, we enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evening just listening to the quiet. The breakfast in the morning was simply delicious & the conversation was always enjoyable & informative. I'm so glad that my husband found this B & B, & that it was so close to our daughter's residence at the Navy Housing.
reviews.title: Mother's Day Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mariana and Rosemary went out of their way to accommodate us. The food was fabulous and the beautifully redone farmhouse was bright and airy. They are great hosts who are passionate and knowledgable about the area. Just a short drive from Saratoga Springs, this relaxing setting is the prefect place to unwind at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Comfortable and inviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great weekend at The Saratoga Farmstand. The place was immaculate, and the service was incredible, as was the food. I highly recommend staying here if you are in the Saratoga Springs area. The property was beautiful and we were there in the fall. I am sure the grounds are even more perfect in the summer. The Inn Keepers were amazing, and very helpful, they really made our stay even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Veterans Day weekend is Saratoga Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great food, room and hosts. They could not be nicer. Food was outstanding. Very clean. This should be your first choice. Excellent for. Friends, family or business. Great value, especially during Track Season. Since it is on 10+ acres of farmland, it is very peaceful. The well water was amazing too.
reviews.title: Best B&B I have ever visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I knew that I was going to enjoy my stay at the Saratoga Farmstead from the moment I spoke to Marianna on the telephone. Her warmth and friendliness convinced me that I had selected the right place to stay for our time in Saratoga Springs. It got even better when we met Marianna and Rosemary in person, saw their lovely home and checked in to our beautiful, comfortable room. It was a step back in time with all the comforts you would want on a vacation. The only thing missing was a TV (my partner and I are TV addicts!), but we had such a good time we didn't miss it. The comfortable parlor room was stocked with snacks, soft drinks and local wines and beers - what a treat! Best of all, you wake up to a fabulous farm to table breakfast prepared by two chefs. It really doesn't get better than this. If you're considering a stay in Saratoga, give Marianna and Rosemary a call. It's the first step toward creating a wonderful, memorable experience.
reviews.title: A wonderful farmstead experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this perfectly lovely B&B to be the perfect spot to stay in Saratoga. Just far enough out of town to miss all of the tourist chaos downtown yet easily convenient to the race track, restaurants or anything else. Rosemary and Mariana were the perfect hosts and the daily breakfasts were delightful. The accommodations were delightful. We will definitely go back again when we return to Saratoga.
reviews.title: Perfect spot in the country yet close to everything at the Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay here was nice and the Innkeepers were pleasant enough but overall, I found this B&B disappointing.
reviews.title: Beautiful property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: First, I'll just say that the property was beautiful and you really feel like you're in the country. The only sounds you hear at night are the crickets and locusts and you wake up to the birds chirping. It's quite nice. Breakfast was complete and delicious.
reviews.title: Simple Pleasures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mariana and Rosemary run a great B&B. The place is spotless. The breakfast is delicious. The recommendations for dinner in Saratoga Springs were spot on. Places we wouldn't come across without Mariana's suggestions.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was generous in size and very comfortable. I wholeheartedly recommend this B&B.
reviews.title: You'll Sleep & Eat Like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic B&B just a few minutes out of Saratoga Springs, NY...this is an old farmhouse that has been renovated into a beautiful country style home and is quite large. It has been decorated beautifully and is owned by a wonderful Italian Lady who will do anything to make your stay special. She had us scheduled in an upstairs room but said we could have the run of the house and offered us free wine/beer/beverages and told us she normally turns the lights off around 10:30pm which was fine for us because we were beat! The night was very quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable, so much so that when my head hit the pillow, I was out like a light. Breakfast was at 900am and was great...they had prepared an omelette with fresh vegetables picked that morning from her own garden...fresh coffee...OMG...LIFE IS GREAT IN SARATOGA SPRINGS, NY.
reviews.title: An amazing retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: WOW! Thats all I can say! Mariana and Rosemary have the most beautiful B and B! If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, and relaxing stay in beautiful Saratoga Springs, this is the place to stay! Last year we stayed at at the Marriot which was good, but this year there were no vacancies at any hotel because of the Farm Aid Concert. While searching the web, I luckily came across this place. I called and booked a room right away. We arrived there at 10:30 pm and walked right in to our bedroom. In the morning we awoke to an amazing breakfast with local products and some homemade goodies. They pay great attention to food allergies. My girlfriend has certain requirements and they had everything specially prepared for her. We will no longer go to any other place when doing our yearly Saratoga trip. Rosemary and Mariana stole our hearts! You will not be disappointed! Almost forgot! It is in a quiet, perfect location 5 minutes away from town!
reviews.title: Beautiful location, close to activities yet removed and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere was very quiet and calm. We were welcomed warmly and provided with a delicious farm to table breakfast. We picked our own apples and enjoyed the surrounding activities including hiking around geysers and rivers, eating in town and walking through the local farmers market. The price is a bit high but well worth it. We had a short stay but could easily have enjoyed a few more days there.
reviews.title: A B&B that delivered on every level!

description: "Just 5 minutes from downtown Saratoga Springs yet a world away!" Enjoy peace and quiet at Saratoga's only Certified Green B&B. This lovingly restored 1860's farmhouse is chef-owned. Wonderful breakfasts are customized to guests dietary needs, using fresh local ingredients, much for the farmstead's own gardens. Guest rooms are comfortable and decorated with antiques and art. All have private baths, AC, individually zoned heat and ceiling fans. Included are complimentary locally brewed beers, eco-friendly wines, other beverages and snacks.
